result.rationale: This species is restricted to the upper Caroní River, Gran Sabana Region in Venezuela. It has an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 5,772 km<sup>2</sup>. Illegal mining is leading to a continuing decline in habitat quality and extent, and there are six locations based on this threat. Therefore, it is assessed as Vulnerable.
result.geographicrange: This species is known from the Orinoco Basin (Venezuela), where it is restricted to the upper Caroní River, Gran Sabana region, Bolívar state (Lasso 1989, Lasso et al. 2004).
result.population: It is apparently a very rare species in its natural environment.
result.habitat: It occurs in black and clear water rivers of Venezuelan Guiana (upper Caroní, Gran Sabana region), in rocky bottom rivers, in very fast waters with strong currents (Lasso 1989, Lasso et al. 2009).
result.threats: Mining (for bauxite, copper, coltan, diamonds, iron and gold) is a threat in most of its distribution area in the upper Caroní basin within the Orinoco (Orinoco Mining Arc-AMO), which results in deforestation, riverbed alteration, sedimentation, contamination by heavy metals, and spills of gasoline, oil and human sewage (CERLAS 2019, Hitcher 2020, SOS-Orinoco 2020).
result.conservationmeasures: There are no conservation plans for this species in the area, although its range includes Canaima National Park (Lasso 1989, Lasso et al. 2009). Research is needed to better determine its distribution, population size and trend.
